thread.title: Maroons to hold State of Origin fan day in Mackay in 2017 | Perth Now
thread.title_full: Maroons to hold State of Origin fan day in Mackay in 2017 | Perth Now

title: Maroons to hold State of Origin fan day in Mackay in 2017 | Perth Now
text:
Queensland’s class of 2017 to greet fans in region rich with talent PETER BADEL, The Courier-Mail February 21, 2017 4:18pm 
QUEENSLAND’s record-breaking Origin juggernaut will spread the rugby league gospel by staging this year’s Fan Day at Mackay. 
The Queensland Rugby League confirmed today the Maroons’ class of 2017 will visit the north Queensland town, which has produced some of the code’s most illustrious names, including Wendell Sailor, Dale Shearer, Martin Bella, Steve Jackson, Owen Cunningham, Travis Norton and Neville Costigan. 
In more recent times, Cronulla’s grand final star and former Dally M winner Ben Barba, Manly halfback Daly Cherry-Evans and current Maroons winger Dane Gagai have graduated to the NRL from the region. media_camera Mackay product Dane Gagai scores during Origin II in 2016. Photo: Adam Head 
The Maroons’ regional sojourns have been a smash hit in recent years with residents from Roma, Bundaberg and Gladstone throwing their weight behind the most successful unit in Origin history. 
The Queensland squad led by Cameron Smith and Johnathan Thurston will arrive in Mackay on June 14 — a week before State of Origin II. 
“This part of Queensland has produced some amazing talent over the years and hopefully our visit before Game II of this year’s series will inspire more young players to get involved in our great game,” Queensland coach Kevin Walters said. 
“Our players take a lot away from these Fan Days too as they get to witness first hand just how passionate our supporters are. 
“I still vividly remember the young family who travelled more than four hours to get autographs in Gladstone last year. I don’t travel that far for a holiday.” media_camera Cameron Smith of the Maroons runs the ball. Photo: Getty Images. 
QRL boss Rob Moore said his organisation was delighted to support the team’s visit to Mackay. 
“Like many regional communities, the Mackay District is going through a challenging period and we trust this event will bring some cheer to the area,” Moore said. 
“We’re extremely proud of this program, which is now stronger than ever thanks to the support provided by Suncorp. 
“It’s humbling to know that many regional fans, sporting bodies and businesses got so much out of previous Fan Days in Emerald, Bundaberg, Longreach, Proserpine and Gladstone.”
